title: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhed: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?

title: Europe will 'stand united' in response to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland
Amichai Chikli, the Israeli diaspora affairs minister challenging the Jewish diaspora
Russian militarization of winter hardens resolve in Kyiv: 'We're freezing, but we won't give in'
subhed: Daily Russian attacks on energy infrastructure have left residents of the Ukrainian capital without electricity and heating as temperatures drop to −15°C. The strategy does not appear to have dampened Kyivans' spirits.

title: Fatal rail accident in Spain after trains collide
subhed: At least 21 people were killed and 73 were injured after two trains collided in southern Spain. Spanish media said the number could reach 100 with passengers trapped in the carriages.

title: New York rapper A$AP Rocky makes comeback in new album, balancing fury and serenity
subhed: After an eight-year wait, the artist – and Rihanna's partner – has released his fourth album, 'Don't Be Dumb.' The varied and accomplished record features collaborations with Tim Burton, Tyler, The Creator, Doechii and Damon Albarn.

title: The meteoric rise of Arthur Mensch, France's AI champion
subhed: In less than three years, the co-founder and head of the young French start-up Mistral AI has become a leading figure in the rapid rise of artificial intelligence worldwide.

Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
subhed: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.

title: In Libya's desert, Sudanese refugees cross paths as they flee or return to their homeland
subhed: Between 350,000 and one million Sudanese refugees have arrived in Libya since the outbreak of war in April 2023. In the southern city of Kufra, refugees end up in unsanitary camps. With no prospects, some decide to return to Sudan, despite the horrors of the fighting.

title: 'That 'Stranger Things' brings Prince or David Bowie back to life is both wonderful and dreadful'
subhed: In the final episode of the hit Netflix series, 15- to 25-year-olds discovered 'Purple Rain' and 'Heroes,' whose streams have soared across music platforms. Unfortunately, the younger generation has limited itself to these snippets, showing little interest in the artists or their discographies, writes Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde, in his column.
